intro: Dudleya parishii, commonly known as the Santa Barbara Dudleya, is a succulent plant native to California. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are typically fleshy and covered in a layer of white wax. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Dudleya parishii is well adapted to arid environments and is often found in coastal scrub habitats.
